title: Warhol Font
content:
Does anyone know of a font based on the early Andy Warhol handwriting? During his commercial art phase...Seems like an excellent project if not.....

[http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7295/11700812884\_ede4dea191\_z.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141103045658/http:/farm8.staticflickr.com/7295/11700812884_ede4dea191_z.jpg "http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7295/11700812884\_ede4dea191\_z.jpg")

Sorry for the link...the image insert didn't work.

David Stafford
author: Davex

comments.content:
I haven't seen one, but then again there's a lot hand written fonts a have yet to see.

Be neat-o if it came with Basquiat alt chars...

That is his mother Julia's handwriting, not Andy Warhol's.  
It has been done as FF Pepe.

That might have been the inspiration for FF Pepe. [https://www.fontfont.com/fonts/pepe](http://web.archive.org/web/20141103045658/https:/www.fontfont.com/fonts/pepe "https://www.fontfont.com/fonts/pepe")
Yeah, you posted in the time it took me to wrack my brain and fetch the link!
Thank you. I haven't been logged for a long time so I've missed these entries. I'll look for FF Pepe.
Is there a font in this style, which is free?
Offhand I know of none (never looked), but you could try scanning through the lists on Dafont.
